Row.Text: What is your business in Wallachia? I am Vlad III Tepes, her noble prince. See these impaled souls behind me? Be careful or you'll wind up skewed alongside them.
You are brave to enter these lands. Or perhaps foolish. I am Vlad III Tepes, prince of Wallachia.
I go to my grave leaving behind a nightmare buried deep within this princedom. It will one day destroy you.
So it was with bravery that you steps into my lands. Take good care of my forest of impalements.
Well, well. You're a sick fellow aren't you? Come back to gaze upon the horrors that befell my enemies?
I doubt you're here for anything worthwhile.
You're back. How annoying...
Shall I cut off your ears? You're clearly not using them.
Perhaps your eyes need to be gouged out. You're clearly unable to see what a good deal looks like.
Are you done offering these pathetic deals?
Please - sit, friend. Don't worry, I won't stab you.
You've business then. So speak.
Be careful. My stabbing hand is getting itchy.
What is it?
So you've come to surrender then? Have you decided on a spot that you'd like to be skewered?
There isn't anything to say if it's not about your surrender. Get on with it.
Yes, I think of you as a friend. But that doesn't mean I want you around all the time.
Well, friend?
It amuses me that you come when you're about to be destroyed.
I am not interested in discussing your war, if that's why you are here.
Do you soldiers see what lies for them if they enter my lands? Turn back or every last one of them will die.
I will skewer your men if you do not remove them from my lands. All who enter Wallachia uninvited are enemies.
Be careful with your expansion. I will catch one of your settlers one day and eat them.
I willy gladly force you back if you cannot control your expansion.
Gold will not restore the earth that I will salt because of this transgression. You cannot merely buy my lands.
I have noticed that you're getting too close to my lands. Turn back now or face the consequences.
Your army is very strong, and I would be right to fear it.
Your pockets are overflowing with gold. Care to leave some of it laying around for us less fortunate rulers?
Are you having some trouble expanding?
Fear not. The children that don your soldiers' garb will face the same fate should you seek to invade me.
You are called a warmonger, but I do not see it.
It is difficult to make friends. I have a habit of stabbing them. You'll give a Declaration of Friendship with me a chance won't you?
You are the first leader that I want to see kept alive. Would you agree to a Declaration of Friendship.
I promise you that I will do my utmost to defend you and your people, if you would agree to a Declaration of Friendship with me.
I am not interested.
This would be of no service to me.
I want you to denounce {1_CivName}. As my friend, you will agree to this without question.
It is time that {1_CivName}'s fate be sealed, and I need you to join me on the battlefield. What do you say? (WILL DECLARE WAR IMMEDIATELY)

I will let the others know in advance that you will soon be joining my forest of impalements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Do not be surprised if you wake up one morning and your guts are spilling from your belly.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Your threat to my princedom is too great to be ignored. Consider this my warning to you.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Well then. You'd better start running before I catch and gut you.
You'd best not stick around then. I've been looking for someone new to join my forest of impalements.
You have authored your own demise.
So, you've become friends with {1_CivName}. This is reassuring.
I recommend that you not get too close with {1_CivName}. If so... we might have problems getting along.
I'll have you know that {1_CivName} and I have worked together in the past, and I have the utmost respect for them. Just so you're aware.
Glad to hear there are others in the world that share my disgust with {1_CivName}. They are clearly not to be trusted.
I see that you are now friends with {1_CivName}. Good.
I share your disdain for {1_CivName}. Perhaps one day we will have them for dinner.
Your relationship with {1_CivName} troubles me.
Enjoy your time with {1_CivName}. Knowing them, they will dispose of you before too long.
Your soldiers will decorate my pallisades nicely. That is, if you do not remove them from my lands.
I will give you a chance to move your armies away from my lands.
The next settler that I catch near my lands will be send back to you in pieces.
I warn you to keep away from my lands.
Do you think I will not impale your merchants buying up my lands? I will, I assure you.
Keep your gold and stay away from my lands.
My disdain for {1_PlayerName:textkey} has become too much to bear. This is a situation that can only be resolved on the battlefield. Will you join me, friend?
{1_PlayerName:textkey} has become a blight on my people. One that can only be dealt with through war. I seek allies - can I count you among them?
{1_PlayerName:textkey} is a threat to the stability of this world. The time has come to deal with them once and for all. Will you assist me in this effort?

It's come to my attention that you're getting a little friendly with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. In case you weren't aware, they're within my sphere of influence, and I'd prefer if you stayed out of it.
Begone.
I will agree to this.
Hah. You do not frighten me.
You don't seem to be using your head that much. I should do you a favour and remove it for you.
You would make a fine addition to my forest of impalements, don't you think?
I'm getting sick of seeing your face. Maybe I should tear it off and wear it on mine.
I should come over there and put you in your place on my pallisades.
Your army is so wanting that I fear I would not have enough to build a forest with.
Your soldiers would scare no one, even with their guts around their necks.
I would have you strapped to a nuclear bomb!
I reserve a special place in my palace for bullies like you.
Your people would be happier impaled on my pikes, wouldn't you agree?
I should come over there and put your people out of their misery.
A pathetic attempt at building an empire. Why do you bother?
Have you been a bit too free with your culling, too? I dare say this explains your pathetic size.
A pathetic and meagre culture. Not worth pillaging, frankly.
It must only be through devilry that your pathetic culture has managed to sustain itself.
You have a luxury resource that I want. Now, you know that I'm not one to be refused.
What do you think of an Open Borders arrangement with me?
I gladly invite you to witness the horrors that await your men.
I see, and from which end do you prefer me to skew you one a pike?
Yes, I think I have a dozen or so pikes to impale your soldiers on.
I will not be easily defeated. Your men will cower in fear as they near my lands.
Your men will face much horror in the coming war.
You have conspired against me too long. You will join the army of dead that don my pallisades.
You best bring your best men to face me, because when I capture you, I will slowly roast you alive.
I have submitted to your will too long. It is time to see what your guts look like.
I am ordained by God to expand my princedom and I will continue with you.
I continue my mission to cover the earth with my princedom by taking you on.
Then I will begin thinking of all the ways I am going to torture you for this when I capture you.
Do not talk to me about peace.
I am prepared to talk peace. If you let me slice off your toes.
You mustn't care for your pretty head if you come begging for peace at this hour.
No. Now get out before I get the urge to plunge a knife into your skull.
Our people are now sleeping in coffins and drinking the blood of their enemies! We're worried the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
We are glad to see that your people are now sleeping in coffins and drinking the blood of their enemies. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
